It came with goat cheese and some kind of nut mix on top. The granola was crispy and perfect. Coffee was great. Another thing I love is that they add the tax to the price already so when they say something is $7, it is $7. It's great. Anyhow, I plan on coming back next week to try the Benedict. I drive to Berkeley once a month to have the best ones at Venus -- I've tried them in so many places in SF to great disappointment. But the ones at Black Sands looked solid - if anything the bread didn't looks soggy which is my biggest complaint. Great spot.
author: Miriam L.

description: I think I just found my new neighborhood hangout spot! Totally underrated - they brew their own beer and cold brew! I got a Bloody Mary, which was v tasty.. but $11. A little pricey but well worth it. They have a bit of a hipster vibe // playing a lot of oldies on the speakers. Probably not great for a boozy, loud brunch but maybe solo or with a couple friends -- definitely recommend! I will be back!
author: Riley M.

description: Went here for both dinner and brunch. The chicken sandwich is insanely good, and the torta is to die for. Crowded spot, but the service is fast and efficient. Beer selection is ace; the Saison made my night!
author: Andrea A.

description: I love this place! The avocado toast, with an egg, was the best I've ever had. The cream cheese on it tasted homemade. The people working there were friendly and helpful and the WiFi works well. Would highly recommend!
author: Aleksandra T.

description:
Worst meal in SF in 30 years. Love the space. The beer is good. The food is a complete disaster. I had enjoyed the space for an SF brew event. It was lively and and had a cool urban vibe.

Went back specifically to enjoy a nice weather day as they have good outdoor seating and wonderful bright light. 

We hit the Snack Menu 4p-6p.
The smashed burger was nothing more than a Jumbo Jack with wimpy patties too thin to not overcome. Medium rare was fully cooked with a hint of pink..

The onion rings are wrong. Never expected to have large papery dried fish flakes hanging off the the rings. This made the ribs taste poorly. If they were thinking to use them to add a salty flavor jut use salt. 

My friend had a cheese dip and tortilla chips with a liquids sauce with a few jalapeños drowned in the sauce.

This is not grub pub food. It is more like fish food. Some chef over thought the menu and tried to do some crapy samurai fusion. Too bad.

Super disappointed. I would only go back to drink beer. Also do not recommend to go at 4 pm... There was no wait staff and the bar tender was too over stretched to provide good service.

The kitchen did get the food out fast. Perhaps there are appetizing things on the menu. Too many stellar places to bother with this one on Haight St.
author: Janis C.

description:
Black Sands just opened a couple of days ago.
The team behind this new operation is young, ambitious and hungry.

Their breakfast food menu is a testing ground for their inventive recipes.
Looking forward to see their extended lunch/dinner ideas once it's time.

What Black Sands excells in though is their brewing operation with the adjunct hone brew supply store.
Big thumbs up.
Great guidance & great supplies.

I feel it will take a couple of weeks until the service, kitchen & menu are in sync, but am sure when this happens it will be a five star place.

Thumbs up!
author: Artur L.

description: Really enjoyed this place.  Been here twice and ordered the chicken sandwich both times and both times very tasty.  For lunch it comes with a salad or fries, both great.  You only get the sandwich for dinner.  Came here for lunch on a Friday, not many people at that time.  Came again for dinner on a Wednesday and it was a packed house.  Clean, great decor, and nice place to eat and have a couple drinks.  Decent selection of beers and service was good.
author: Anh N.

description: Great food, uuuuhhh-maaaahhhhzing host (kudos, bro! Witticisms much appreciated), shitty service. The fluffy eggs made up for the wait and the daft apathy.
author: Kat F.

description:
The beer (which I have put in my very own mouth and swallowed, firsthand, just to be clear) is, in my opinion, average and overpriced. And the brewing of it results in a bad smell wafting about outside. I follow the owner's personal recommendation and cross the street to avoid the smell. I'm not sure what they suggest for their outside seating arrangement. Maybe you can ask to move your table snd chairs across the street too...

You can buy a slice of toast here for $5, which is the most expensive slice of toast in my neighborhood (surpassing even The Mill, famed for its astonishingly expensive $4 slice of toast). In honesty, I haven't tried the toast because (in my humble opinion) spending $5 on a slice of toast would make me a bit of a wanker.

Also, my negative review of Black Sands has been removed twice now, and the business owners have sent me two very condescending messages. Not the best way to get people to like you. Sorta makes me wonder how many other negative reviews they have reported and got removed...
author: Kate H.

description: We picked tjis place by chance while walking down hight st. Quick service, delicious food friendly staff. Nice atmosphere too, a must on haight st.
author: Hadas W.

description:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to review Black Sands! When I found out that a microbrewery and restaurant were planning on filling the space at 701 Haight, I was stoked. What Black Sands has brought to the neighborhood is exactly what we've been missing (at least in my opinion!) The food is incredible here- I've been twice for dinner and once for brunch. Highlights so far have been: the shrimp tacos, the veggie burger, and the taco salad. Everything is incredible fresh and flavorful, service is quick and friendly, and the space is beautiful. I also had the opportunity to interview Cole, one of the head brewers, for my company's blog (http://bit.ly/213xc7h) and he was awesome! The brewers at Black Sands are all about helping the home brewing community make delicious beer, as well as serving up unique beers on tap. 

If you haven't made the time to check out Black Sands, I'd recommend you do it ASAP :)
author: Eliza D.

description:
REALLY! Can't you at least keep the site updated. PUHLEEZ! it can't be that difficult to do.
 To plan an evening out only to arrive to find the reason to patronize your establishment is beer the beer, and for the beer choices to be not as advertised is DISAPPOINTING. .
author: h. w.

description: This is one of those I want to love this place reviews. Yes, I want to love Black Sands because it's in my hood, it's well designed, has a thoughtful menu, and good liquor. Unfortunately, it fell short of expectations.  The cocktails were more one note in flavor than their menu descriptions and the appetizers were just acceptable. Where it really fell short was the service and the lack of warmth in a neighborhood joint. Instead, it gave me the new SF vibe.  Maybe it's just me...and not Black Sands.  Welcome to your new home.
author: Joel A.

description:
Food was expensive and portions were small. The two beers I had on tap were not good. Several draft beers on their menu were no longer available. They need some serious help.

The service was even worse. The condescending and flat-out rude attitude from at least 3 of the servers/bartenders was shocking.

Everyone we interacted with was extremely confident in answering your questions. Unfortunately, they were frequently (and unapologetically) incorrect a few times during our dinner--served us a sparkling wine and swore to us that it was a sour beer, served us a salad instead of a noodle dish we saw the chef making (turned out to be the "staff meal"), etc. No one seems to really care enough to get things right. 

Will come back to this location if/when it gets replaced with a new restaurant/brewery in 6-12 months.
author: Ryan E.

description: Pretty space, excellent service. If only I drank beer.  Portions were perfect for my diet. Just wish they had more of a selection. I've definitely visit if I was in the area.
author: Leah L.

description:
Review is for the brunch: 

The granola was delicious but the breakfast torta did not stand out and tasted pretty plain. It came with potatoes that did not have much flavor or spice. I don't know about the other items on the menu, but the torta was definitely a pass for me. 

The outside patio is dog-friendly which is nice, though as a note, if you're eating breakfast/brunch here, there is no shade on the patio and it can get pretty hot with the sun on your face as you eat.
author: Derrick W.

description:
Literally the best burger I have had in SF.

Keep in mind I have just moved from Brooklyn, where burgers and meat in general hold a higher place in food. 
The thing is, if you love thick, raw, fancy restaurant burgers with artesian cheese, go home. If you want an amazing burger that is reminiscent of fast food, but with a higher quality, this is your place. Two thin slices of beef with cheese on each and lettuce and sauce and that's all. Thanks. I don't want tomatoes anyway. The beer is good too!
author: Niki S.

description: My bf and I were excited to try this place being it is close by and after reading the reviews. We stopped in here late afternoon on Sunday for a quick bite to eat. The place was pretty empty so we grabbed a table ordered some beers, fish tacos and a flatbread. Beer was great and the place seemed awesome but unfortunately the same can't be said for the food and service. After about 30 minutes the flatbread came out and we were told our fish tacos were on the way. Meanwhile the people next to us had come in, ordered, received their tacos and were finishing up. After about 55 minutes the tacos arrived with the smallest piece of fish I have ever seen, it didn't even fill half the small taco. Watching the service the food seemed to just go to random tables depending on who grabbed the plate. A new group of people seated next to us also had their order come out wrong and piece by piece. Overall the beer is great but the food service seemed to have no one in charge and the food itself was extremely disappointing.
author: Maggie L.

description: Seriously one of the best burgers I've ever had! Stopped in here for a quick bite around 3:30- luckily they had a few bar eats available, as well as the burger. I got a nice glass of rose, and my boyfriend got the Saigon beer which was also delicious. Great service too. Ill definitely be coming back!
author: Izzy D.

description:
Excited only to be disappointed.

My brother had good things to say about this place so I decided to check it out. As I entered I got greeted by this monotone bartender with long hair and a cap (not the friendliest) but I guess you can't expect friendly at 9 pm on a Sunday. Now when I ordered a burger, I also specified to add on bacon and an egg, can't be that difficult to jot that down on a paper when you're taking an order unless of course you are just trying to remember it off the top of your head and when you reiterate it back to me you get it wrong and I have to correct you, oh yah that's what happened. After 15 min, I get my order and specifically asked, "everything is in here right" and the long haired cap wearing bartender who is too cool for school just gave me a nod. Didn't think much of it till I got home only to see my burger had neither of the add ons I had asked for along side some over salted mcdonalds looking fries.....  Blacksands SF , thank you but no thank you.

$5 of non existent add ons, over priced food with jack in the box quality, I rather save my money and visit The Grind Cafe up the street for wayyyy better tasting food, better service, and where they actually write down your order when you place it!
author: Marlon M.

description: The entitled hipsters who work there need to get over themselves. Similar to the situation of another reviewer, my experience had to do with the militant closing of the kitchen at 2 pm (on a Sunday). I arrived at about 1:42 and was promptly told the kitchen was closing. The server hovered over me until I ordered. I order food then a cocktail. Five minutes later the Benedict I ordered comes out and I can see the under cooked eggs jiggling around but I decide to taste them anyway. Stone cold!! I send it back and, presumably because the kitchen wanted to get out of there, the server has the audacity to come back to me with my plate and say that these are poached eggs and do not looked undercooked to him. I tell him that they are and that I'm beyond annoyed about how rushed I was at a quarter to 2. He tells me last call was at 1:45, like I should care. the menu and website says 2, not 1:45. So I get up and tell him that he's just lost my business and walked out. Never again. You get one chance to impress. And I wasn't going to sit there like some of these masochistic SF diners and eat something that wasn't cooked properly.
author: Mark V.

description: It's tough to stand out as a micro-brewery in San Francisco, and as a Haight resident I wanted to love Black Sands. Unfortunately, the few brews they have are average - your run of the mill hoppy IPAs (and if you don't like hoppy beers, good luck). The interior is modern and clean, but to me, it lacks soul. There isn't really anything that stands out about Black Sands except the home-brew pop-up shop and funky bathrooms.
author: Adam Z.

description: Great beer and great for breakfast but at night this place attracts an insufferable crowd.
author: Bradly W.

description: Came here late at night to grab a beer and burger with my friend. I had the son of man, the garlic fries, and the fried chicken sandwich. Everything was delicious. I especially enjoyed the garlic fries. They did not skimp on the garlic and the wedges were warm and fresh. The servers were incredibly friendly and attentive. This is a great chill spot to hang out at.
author: Manpreet B.

description: Delicious beers and the nicest bartenders in town. They have a full bar as well if you enjoy cocktails. I'm excited to try their food - it looked and smelled good! Well done Black Sands.
author: Brooke S.

description: Great neighborhood pub with good beer selection, bar scene, and food. The cocktails are pretty good too. Nice to be able to saddle up to a bar and watch the wiggle bike riders roll by outside. Also nice to have a mid-range, comfortable and clean bar to bridge the gap between dive and more upscale spots.
author: Todd H.

description:
This review is a month old, so hopefully they have found their stride.

We showed up on a weeknight and found the place packed.  There was a crush of people at the bar and the bartender was pretty clearly overwhelmed.  We tried to stop a server to give our order.  We were told to order at the bar.  Server explained to us that "we are a brewery, so we don't do table service."  This line of reasoning makes no sense when you consider how many breweries in the city have table service. 

We noticed people squatting at tables (seating is at a premium) while waiting for friends to show up.

Our food was excellent, the burger perfectly done, and we all raved about the tacos.   But it took a really long time, and servers kept trying to bring us food that other tables had ordered.  It became a joke between us and the two tables next to us, that we were just going to start claiming each others' food.  People were good natured about the hiccups, but there was definitely some collective eye rolling.  

My husband and I both had the beer flight; the beers ranged from fine to "wow, would totally drink this on the regular."

We would love to return, because it's a gorgeous space and literally on the block we live, but it takes too much energy to deal with the uneven service, when all you want is a good beer, good food and to enjoy the company you're with.
author: Lorin Y.

description: Beer is fine, atmosphere is fine. Their breakfast foods aren't great, but their lunch menu is. Heads up that their website is wrong and the lunch menu/burger/fried chicken sandwich is not available on weekends.
author: Anna S.

description:
The decor of Black Sands is superb. White marble accented with light colored wood gives the restaurant an elegant air while hearkening back to an old world atmosphere. The space feels open and airy, a great place to spend a late summer afternoon.

The food, and especially the beer, were quite good. The pickled vegetables were delicious, and the chicken wings were a pleasant surprise of flavors. The burger was unmemorable. There was a house saison on the menu that was really fantastic, would highly recommend it to someone that enjoys Belgium style beers. Only complaint in the food department was that there were only three chicken wings in the order. Typically chicken wings means sharing in a group setting, but it is a little tough to share three. Also $16 for three wings is a bit outrageous.

They still have a lot of kinks to work out, mainly in the service. It was unorganized and a bit chaotic. We were seated at the chef's bar, but our waiter didn't show up for quite sometime, leaving us to wonder if we were supposed to be ordering somewhere else. Beers took an abnormally long time to materialize, waiters were unsure where to make room to put plates down, a split burger to share came out on one small plate.

Overall I would give this place six months to mature, master their logistics, and then come back and try the food again. In the meantime, I would definitely pop in for another one of the saison's.
author: Michael S.

description: The lunch specials here right now are amazing!  I go twice a week and order the chef's special.  Exceeds expectations every time.
author: Mahdroo M.

description: This place is a haven for lovers of quality craft beer.  They have a reasonably priced beer sampler (aka flight!) and some amazing barrel aged beers.  It's very spacious and modern, and a great place for a snack.  This was just the right place I needed to go for a relaxing few hours, and the staff were very friendly.  Truly excellent memory of San Francisco!!
author: Ian B.

description:
I just stopped by Black Sands for post dinner drinks. The Black Saison beer is delicious. Their fries are so good - fingerling potatoes with a tasty dip.

Definitely worth a visit!
author: Kevin W.

description: great addition to the Lower Haight.  I tried all of their beers that they make in house and they're all pretty tasty!  Even their carrucha (tequila) cocktail was really good.  The food is also pretty good for a brewery!
author: Tammy N.

description: Glad to have this new addition to the neighborhood. While they are no toronado in the amount of beers they have available, their made on-site beers are great and worth a visit. And as an added bonus, their menu clearly marks off the items that are vegan and vegetarian. Ill have to check out the food soon and report back.
author: Jon T.

description:
Black Sands is a huge addition to the neighborhood.  The food is delicious, unique, well-priced, and a cool mix of creative & down-homey.

Now, lets talk about the more important part: the beer.  What the founders of Black Sands are  doing is soon going to be legendary.  From the new beers they are constantly creating which are full of flavor, to the in-store beer supplies, this place is dedicated on a level you rarely see.  Stop by to talk with Andy, and he'll take the time to teach you tons about beer brewing.

Also, the design of the restaurant is top notch.  Not sure what more to say other than we are pumped to have this place in our neighborhood!
author: Andrew K.

description: Quickly becoming my favorite breakfast spot. I haven't tried any of their beer, but all of the food and coffee is great. The granola and yogurt is probably the best I've ever had. I expect this place to become a lot busier in the coming months.
author: Jacob S.

description:
First official day serving dinner here and there's only one person taking food orders. I counted three guys busing tables and none of them were able to take our order. So we sat and waited until a patron suggested we go to the counter and order. That was a crap shoot. Bartenders only take drink orders which is fine because at this point we just wanted our "beer for life" for supporting establishments like these in our neighborhood.  

They are still working out the kinks. More than one person taking food orders would help and I noticed the bathroom line was six people deep!?! I can only imagine what'll be like when the place is packed. 

We'll have to try dinner another time.
author: Eileen Q.

description:
Great beer, wonderful setting on Haight. If you need beer brewing supplies, this is the place for you in SF. Been waiting since the Indigogo campaign, and excited they have finally arrived in the 'hood. 

Staff is super passionate about beer and brewing, and we get to benefit.
author: Ben R.

description: Black Sands is near the top of my best bars list. Shannon is the perfect bartender - warm, funny, and skilled. The in-house brews are crisp and interesting. I favor IPAs, and BS's are wonderfully hoppy. Clean, modern, decor; clear views of the masterful chefs, tanks, and bartenders; and a really cool restroom. And a pretty easy walk from the N (Duboce Park).
author: Savvy S.

description: One of my friends recommended this place to me and I am so glad she did. I came here for breakfast and omg the granola is amazing!!! I have never had granola that tasted this good. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone in the area it will not disappoint not to mention it's a bar at night.
author: Victor L.

description:
Amazing Food! Fantastic service! Bloody Mary's are the best I have EVER had!! We're planning a trip back before our holiday is over. 
The entire experience of dining out- casually was perfect here..
author: Leanne E.

description:
Really wanted to like this place, as it's a block away from my apartment and looks really cool.  I've given them three tries though, and it has been brutal.

Visit 1: brunch at the bar.  Not very busy.  Waited nearly an hour for my food.  Clearly there was a glitch.  Finally got served.  Bacon was super cold.  I asked for a replacement.  That order was warm but super fatty.  Gravy biscuit was so-so.  Food overall a 2.5.  They apologize for the order mix up and discounted the bill.  I appreciated that enough to not write the place off.

Visit 2: walked in around 3pm. Place was DEAD.  I ordered a cold brew coffee to go.  I was told, sorry, we don't do take out coffee service after 2pm.  I thought that was super weird.  Why would you turn away customers when your staff is just standing there twiddling their thumbs.  I can see if it's 8pm and you have a packed bar, but when there is more staff than customers? Doesn't make sense.

Visit 3:  (well, not a visit). I was in a big rush on a Sunday morning.  I called around 11 am and asked to do a takeout order.  I was told "you have to come in person to do a takeout order."  WHAT?! I can understand a no-takeout policy.  But what the heck is a "take-out, but only if you come in to order" policy.  That kind of defeats the purpose of trying to save time....

Anyway.  Two stars. Cool design, recognized their mess up on visit one with the discount, but I'm down.  Maven down the block has a similar vibe, better food, an normal policies.
author: mario k.

description:
The Food can be summarized as creative or improved interpretations on ordinary traditional food. 

The Garlic Fries: described as a refined version of the standard ballpark treat. Too many times at the ballpark they are soggy, cold, and too expensive. Black Sands has made these fries what they were meant to be. Sit at the counter in front of the kitchen and be smacked in the face with a pungent garlic cloud every 120 seconds, until you cry uncle and demand that they make an order for you too.

The Burgers: Comforting in the best of ways. They need a chocolate milkshake on the menu if they don't have one already.

The Wings: Don't ask questions, just put them in your mouth and chew.

The Beer: Constantly rotating and creative. They've produced one of the best IPA's I've had.

The Bathroom: Trippy.

The evening atmosphere: 78% nitrogen, 21% oxygen, 0.9% argon, 0.03% carbon dioxide, and 100% 20 to 30 somethings crowded into a cacophony of social relaxation.

The people: Beautiful. and so are you, according to the storefront.
author: Paul C.

description: DO NOT GO HERE!  Want a good reason? I'm a local on Haight Street.  I recently had crutches and simply wanted to get out of the house for a bit and arrived at Black Sands about 1 minute after 2pm (remember I'm on crutches) which was 1 minute after what they post as the close time for lunch.  Not only was the bartender rude but when I asked, please - I'll take whatever can be made easily and quickly and noted that the restaurant was still fairly full but he looked at the clock and said NO!  Not an I'm really sorry, nothing!  What type of business treats locals like this?  The locals that will most likely help keep their business open. I will never go back here and will never recommend and equally, if someone asks about it, I'll tell them what others have reviewed.  CRAPPY place - don't go.
author: Abbe C.

description: Met some friends here last night - really fun.  Beer is good, food is very good and the staff is the best.  The warm olives, tostadas, chicory salad and brussel sprouts were all very tasty.  It's a small space that got loud as it populated and a long wait for the bathroom; otherwise 5 stars for sure.  We will definitely return
author: Kim G.

description:
I've been trying to get myself over to Black Sands for the better part of three weeks now and I'm pleased to say the wait was well worth it.  Got in just before 6, right when they start serving food, and the place was pretty much empty.  Grabbed a seat at the bar and readied myself.  Note to anyone coming with a large group, Seating is at a premium here if you want an actual table. I counted probably only 6-7 tables and only one was a 6 seat table.  On the other hand  they do have is seating all around the perimeter of the bar so it was easy enough to snag some wall space.

Beers/Drinks 9/10: Black sands has a rotating cast of beer.  MY drinking companion and I decided to try what was Black Sand brewed to get the full experience but there were other beers on tap and in bottles.  The SMASH Ella Saison was flowery and not overly sour which i liked.  Had good color and I could have easily drank a kegs worth.  The SMASH Mosaic IPA was another great house beer. One interesting thing was by the time we were ready to order our second round they told us that they were already out of the Mosaic.  This befuddled my companion and I considering that it was only about 7:30 but i'll chalk it up to it being the favorite.  The bar also had an extensive cocktail menu.  I ordered just your standard Manhattan to see how it stood up and was very pleased with the results.  THINKING they may have had home made bitters but didn't ask.

Food 9/10:  The menu is not the longest in the world for dinner but they hit all the right notes for shared plates and good entrees at a reasonable price.  I ordered the fish tacos and loved the spicy chipotle sauce and radish like slaw.  Friend had some sort of fried rice with a fried egg and this did not last long on here plate before she unhinged her jaw and engulfed the plate.  Wish we had tried the side of fries, we could smell the garlic aioli wafting from the kitchen.

Cannot wait to go again on a free night and recommend you do the same.  Friendly bartenders and a low key scenery.
author: Ryan F.

description: Black Sands is a fun place to grab a beer or brunch while catching up with friends. I recommend the veggie scramble. The only downsides are $2 for a refill of coffee and the interior coupled with the clientele's fashion style will make you feel like you are in a restaurant/bar from the HBO series "Girls." Update: 80s denim with no belt and a full display of camel toe was never a good idea, but thanks to the fashion trends set by said tv show, it's on full display here. Oh well. To each their own. Black Sands is a well located and inviting place that is easily accessible from all areas in the city.
author: Mark H.

description: This food was amazing. Whoever plans these meals has his shakes aligned. Some of the best food in a city that's littered with amazing restaurants. Hats off to the chef team.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Excellent, brand new restaurant in the Alamo Square area. Coconut toast dish was surprisingly sweet with a great, creamy texture. The breakfast torta was my favorite dish on the menu. Fresh avocado blended with scrambled eggs and sweet onions. Basically a poached egg toasted in the oven for a few minutes, with some excellent grilled bread and chick peas for some great texture. Coffee was also freshly brewed and delicious.

They also have a fantastic beer selection - I had the pilsner and a great shochu barrel aged stout. Looking forward to them starting dinner service and adding the cocktail menu. The head chef Eric mentioned that the director of the cocktail menu from Lazy Bear is going to be joining and I love their drinks!

Great start to the restaurant. I have a few craft brewing friends I'll also send over - looks like they have a great setup for brewing.
author: Michael L.

description:
The atmosphere is great for a drink and the beer is delicious, and for that this should be a five star review. The only reason it's 4 is because I ordered ribs and they were awful, my friends got the burger and loved it so, for next time I'll go there for the beer and enjoy that for what it is :)

Don't expect too much from the food but the beer is amazing!
author: Sara A.

description:
New place on Haight. Coffee and brunch by morning, bar by night.
Went here for brunch today. The menu is small, but the coffee and food was delicious!
author: Haley K.

description:
This is based solely on beer, atmosphere, and service, but I think I'm in love!

 Simple aesthetics, good music, bright and spacious

Really good beer, friendly service with an edge

I would really like to come back for brunch post haste. 

This place is the perfect companion to my record digging at rooky ricardos and groove merchant.
author: Caddy M.

description:
Atmosphere: 4 stars- airy, light and fun atmosphere during lunch time. Good music too!

Food: 3.5 stars- we had the BBQ pulled pork, it was good not great. It's apparent that it is fresh quality food but it's missing flavor- it was too bland for my taste. 

Overall, it's a good place. I would come back to try the dinner menu as it has more options.
author: Joanna F.

description:
We have been waiting FOR MONTHS for Black Sands to open.  Having read Hoodline news and past it in the mornings on our morning runs. While we thought it weird that they had previously had a small open house in which they sold wares from their other stores, we thought it would be good to try their breakfast offerings on their second day of their soft opening. 

We had their matcha latte (good), banana bread (very good ), summer scramble and chorizo egg torta sandwich (both very good). The chorizo was pretty spicy, I loved it! 

Ambience is nice with jazz music and some saw dust still on their tables and chairs,  however,  they give you numbers but then don't bring you your food or drinks although they felt embarrassed about it after inquiring. I suppose it's growing pains. 

My girlfriend calls it bullshit. Having been to plenty of new places and soft openings  and given them a generous tip this morning.  This customer detail is more than disappointing.  

We will back for the brews, and I really hope they improve their service,  it will really suck that our long awaited newest watering hole will be for naught.
author: Nabil B.

description:
Nice bar in the lower haight neighborhood. They also brew their own beers, which is pretty nice. The place is nice inside and they have a little terrace for the sunny days. 

Their cocktails are good but the quantity is very small for the price. Same thing for the food, it's great (especially the fries) but there's not much in your plate for the price.
author: Margaux M.

description: Dirty bar, no acknowledgment for over 10 minutes of sitting down. Finally he asked if we needed menus and he passed them over our heads to people behind us who had just walked up. incredibly frustrating poor service. Ended up walking out at that point, tons of places in the area and no need to be treated that way. We live in the neighborhood and have tried multiple times to make this place work, but have been shut down by the extremely bad service at every turn (with the exception of the morning espresso crew). Disappointment at every turn here, masked by trendy hipster shit.
author: Kira M.

description: I went there on Tuesday 5/26 at 7pm for a happy hour.  Three of my friends got there before me and there was one house beer available on tap that they ordered.  By the time I got there, the beer was gone and there were zero house beers available (just guest beers and cocktails).   For a place that calls themselves a brewery in a city like San Francisco this is completely unacceptable.  Was told that they had a busy weekend the prior weekend but what kind of excuse is that?!
author: Chad P.

description: Finally tried this place for brunch. Super mediocre.  Weird menu choices, and overall sub par taste. Maybe lunch and dinner is better?  The music they play is good at least.
author: Max K.

description: We usually don't like California IPAs but these beers were delicious! Found out the brewer is from Ohio so it tasted a bit like home. Food was also great!
author: Brittany R.

description: I was highly skeptical of their menu as each item is so completely foreign and seemingly an artistic take on traditional bar food.  I've just ordered the Taiwanese Fried Chicken and it is so insanely delicious that I've been inspired, after first gobbling them down, to write a review.  My sweet and highly knowledgable waitress Kaly is attentive even despite the ever-growing crowd and she was able to walk me through the beer list til I found a thing I thought she'd like and I do indeed like it.  Really nice atmosphere: the lighting is dark and even though it is I'll I *can* still hear myself think and communicate with those around me without shouting: and the family style seating makes it so accessible. Top notch spot.
author: SR B.

description: Congee was fantastic, and service was, for the most part, good.  The only negative was the tiny water glasses they provide and one hostess's refusal to bring larger water glasses.
author: DarkwingDick _.

description: This is one of my fave spots! It's perfect for any time of day. They have delicious coffee, and outstanding lunch. All fresh ingredients, but obviously is prepared by hand. The staff is friendly, nice and welcoming. Plus, a great spot to come grab a drink! Highly recommend.
author: Venetia P.

description: Fried chicken sandwich, beers and cocktails. All so good. Restaurant and service are quick and friendly. Interior is clean, trendy. Highly recommended.
author: Amy P.

description: Well atmosphere would score about five stars but due to inattentive can't be bothered bartenders a two seems overly generous. High hopes but just because someone hires a designer doesn't mean they have the vision as to how to treat customers.
author: elizabeth m.

description: Very few beers that they brew themselves. Only 3 on tap. With that said, their saison was great. I am not an IPA person, but my fiancé is. He liked both that they had. Didn't try any food. Very small place. But would visit again. (They had a bunch of cocktails on the menu too!)
author: Cheri E.

description: The selection is great, and the staff are pleasant. I'll definitely be back.
author: Justin R.

description: Had the dark rye IPA, complex and completely drinkable.  Looking forward to trying more...
author: Larry H.

description: Had a lot of fun here last night with some friends. The burger is first rate- one of the best in the city. Great fries, fantastic beer selection. I really like the "seat yourself" style too. I'll be back.
author: Alex S.

description:
I have been so looking forward to the opening of this place. I have been here on more than one occasion for their beers. This is NOT a review of the beer, which is very, very good. This is regarding the food. I tried Black Sands about a month after opening for food and beers. Hated the food but thought it was opening issues and they needed to work out some stuff. 

I gave them a second chance today. 
The food is bad. 

Please,please,please investors/owners/managers bring in some food consultants. The menus need a complete re-hauling and you need people who can cook. 

Couple of suggestions: 
1. Hot food should be hot; cold food should be cold. Don't serve salad on a hot plate. Polenta should be very hot (and throughly cooked). You would not serve a cold beer in a warm glass would you? Try the polenta at Brenda's. That is how polenta should taste. 
2. Season the food. Salt and pepper is your friend. 
3. Weird combinations are just that - weird. That's why they are not done by others. Keep it basic. It's a pub. 
4. Don't try to be everything to everybody. Again, it's a pub. Simple food done right will fly out the door. 

The place is beautiful inside and I know a lot of money must have been spent on the remodel. Now just spend a bit more on a food consultant and go simple. 

I do want you to succeed. I'll wait until the new year and give it a shot again. Hoping third times a charm.
author: Maggie P.

description: I came here with my mum for lunch as we were visiting Haight St. I live in San Francisco (she was visiting from England) but I didn't really know where to stop. This was a great choice. We had a little mishap with the food order (it didn't go through to the kitchen so we had a looooong wait) but it was so graciously recovered by our server who was absolutely lovely that neither of us minded in the end. Also, the food was TASTY & that's what counts. Will be back with friends!
author: Fi M.

description:
This place has a cold interior.  The bartenders were rude.  They had run out of grapefruit juice for drinks.  Worst of all, you could not put your name on a list for a table, or talk to a host.  You had to "hover" around a group of people at a table in hopes of possibly getting a seat.  This was unpleasant both for us and for the people still sitting at the table.  People sitting at other tables were trying to take tables next to them as soon as people stood up forcing us to tell them that we had been waiting for the tables.  YUCK!!!  Will never go in there again!! 
Finally, it was truly depressing to see that there could even BE a place like that in the wonderful Lower Haight area.
author: Maureen O.

description: I haven't tried the beer they brew, but the food is surprisingly good, consistently.  I think the kitchen staff have there shit together.  Unfortunately the female bar tender here is extremely rude, consistently.  I've had no trouble with anyone else, they've all been helpful, don't make faces, and huff and puff when I order food.  It's disappointing because I've lived in the neighborhood for a very long time, and this could be a cool hang out.  The food isn't worth being treated like shit.
author: nathan w.

description: Excellent Beer and Excellent food. Always happy to come and check out the latest brew ... Constantly impressed with the quality and taste of the food. Excellent cocktails as well.
author: David H.

description:
Oh f*ck yassss!  More please.  Sh*t!  What the h*ll have I been eating for brunch instead since this place opened six months ago?!  D*amn.  It's not often that I'm a Johnny Come Lately in my own neighborhood.  I'm kind of an OG of the LH, I am a Lower Haightian (that totally predates Lower Hater for all you sniveling little children that think you have a good deal on rent since you started commuting on special shuttles to the peninsula from this hood a few years ago).  But I digress, everyone has to eat... and you should eat well... so you should eat at Black Sands.  The BF (a chef, trained in Paris, lah di dah he's kind of a big deal) and I just had a spontaneous Eating For Sport experience.  Bourbon Apple French Toast, Frijol con Puerco, Breakfast Torta Plate (gluten free cause I wanted tortillas) and California Rice Porridge.  My honey had a Floricane (gin, prosecco, citrus breakfast cocktail) and I had the Shakito (cold press coffee with rum, shaken and strained).  Each item induced involuntary tastebud orgasms.
The space looks amazing (hard to believe it used to be a shady laundromat).  We sat at the kitchen bar and watched the chefs do magic.  Their front of house staff was very attentive, nice and cool (but not in an over bearing hipster tech douche kind of way).  Will be back.  Often.
author: Aimee L.

description:
Great little homebrewing equipment shop.  I dropped by here just to pick up a few standard supplies, which were easily available and in stock.  

Cole was enjoyable to talk to.  Very knowledgeable and told me what I needed to know about sanitizers and gave a couple tips on the beer I am currently brewing.  He also introduced me to a useful piece of equipment for siphoning and took the time to explain it to me. However, he wasn't pushy about selling it after I said I'd think on it.  

 To top it all off, they take credit cards through square so no worries if you don't have cash.  Prices are generally comparable (within 15%) of what I usually buy online. Very convenient location. I haven't used the online order for pickup in store option but that also seems convenient.  I'd say the only disadvantage here is that they are a pretty small shop, so if you're looking for some really specific piece of equipment, you might not be able to find it here.  So just check online before you come into the store.

Overall, I had a good experience and will be returning for future brewing needs!
author: Dan Z.

description: I was quite excited to see that Black Sands is now open, as it looks like a cool spot just two blocks from my house. I tried to check it out for lunch today with a friend, and I say "tried" because after walking in and sitting at the bar for ten minutes, no one even looked our way or acknowledged we were there. Eventually we just left. Pretty lame, as I was hoping this would be my new neighborhood spot.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Love these guys. Great to have a neighborhood homebrew shop.

Cole and Andy are super friendly, very low-key guys. Always happy to help build a recipe or give some input. 

Can't wait for the brewpub!
author: Sam C.

description:
Service was not good the time we went.  We did hear back from the management which meant a lot; as members of the SF Brewer's guild we were disappointed about the overcharge as well, and the way we were treated.  My gut still tells me this may be an issue there, but at least they acknowledged looking into it.  

Again, acknowledge the immediate response to our concerns which is well intended.  Thus, moving to 3 stars.
author: Angela R.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  Came here at 4:15 on a Friday.  Pretty empty, I know, it's early...however, we felt like we were bothering the "zero personality" bartender.  Sorry we asked a question about a person we knew who worked there.  Actually, even the brewers didn't say hello as they were in the doorway when we entered.  We weren't even sure they were open.  We ordered 2 16 oz. of their brews which were okay.  We were looking forward to eating but they don't serve food until 6 pm.   

Honeslty with all the other options in the city, we will not be coming back here.  Too unfriendly & sterile!  We headed down to Tornado, thanks very much!
author: Donna W.

description: What a disappointment! I've waiting for this place to open for so long and it's basically The Mill #2 with beer. I was hoping for a fun spot to drink a beer with friends, but this is an all encompassing coffee shop/restaurant that just happens to serve beer... I thought it would be a little bit more authentic.
author: Sarah K.

description: Really good food, but very noisy place... I come there during week, otherwise there is way too much noise during weekend because way more people. It's also a pretty place, well decorated.
author: Michèle B.

description:
Perhaps I will write an update with more stars in the future but so far the experience here is too inconsistent to give them more than 2. 

They don't have published hours yet, so I have on several occasions tried to go there with friends, only to find the door locked. 

And although their coffee and pastries are great, the few times I've actually gotten into the place, there is no sense of urgency in filling the order. I have on a few occasions had to leave without my order because I waited so long -- while the folks working there are busy chatting up other customers. 

There's clearly been a lot of effort and passion put into creating this business over the past year or so, but I think they need to step up their service quality and consistency if they don't want to become a cautionary tale. 

Not so sure I'll put in the effort of trying them again.
author: Mark D.

description: Solid modern gastropub in the Lower Haight.  We came here looking for dinner on a Saturday night and found seats at the bar immediately. The space is California-industrial and features table seating with substantial bar seating and also chefs table seating. Cocktails and beer were solid as expected but the food was surprising - first, the prices were actually *reasonable* compared to other gastropubs in the area and on top of that the portions were real portions (not the dreaded *shared plate*). I think this would be a really nice place to meet friends in the area without having to feel like you rationalized your meal after seeing the bill at the end. Also it could be a good date spot as well (good drinks and cool ambiance especially if you sit at the bar or chef's table), although I think the people sitting next to us were on a first-ish date and they had to watch me eat my double cheese burger sloppily next to them so it is what it is.
author: J L.

description:
Excellent veggie burger, second only in my experience to the one at Houstons/Hillstone. In fact, I think they may have copied. Both use beets as a base, though Black Sands' beets are much chunkier (which was tasty but made the burger fall apart).

Would be 5 stars but the brussels sprouts had a 80:20 ratio of oil to sprouts.
author: Charles D.

description: When I realized a micro (maybe nano) brewery was opening so close to my apartment, I was immediately excited. When I realized it'd be over 6 months before they opened, I thought they would never meet my anticipation.  However, they have exceeded my expectations. The place is run by beer lovers who just seem to want to share their passion for beer.  The small craft brew store they open is a great example of how they demonstrate this.  However, black sands is so much more. Their menu, although limited, is delicious.  Everything I've eaten has beaten my expectations; torta, noodles, burger, curry special, etc.  Even their granola (something I usually overlook as boring for a meal) is incredibly good.  Oh, and of course their beer is pretty solid too. The only thing I'd like to see is more beer on tap!  Thank you black sands!  You guys are great!
author: Kevin S.

description: I live right around the corner and I couldn't be happier to call Black Sands my neighbor. They brew their beer in small batches so there's always something new and exciting on the beer list. I have a lot of food restrictions - strict vegetarian and no dairy - and it's always easy for me to find something delicious on their seasonal menu. Great service, stellar beer, delicious food, in a beautiful but not overdone environment; I'm not sure what else I could ask for from my neighborhood bar. You should come here!
author: Christina E.

description:
Bartender with the beard:
Your job is to get people beers not try and bang the customers. I waited for 10 minutes and you never glanced our way once. Please just try and forget yourself and make black sands the awesome place it should be. Because it is. If you don't get in the way anyway.
author: Chris A.

description: We only drank. They have a full bar, visiting taps and 3 of their own. Points for having the grand cry sour bottles (my favorite). Their pale ale and saison are equally tasty with refreshing flavors and not too much intensity.
author: Zara S.

description: Delicious biscuits and gravy paired with a flight of solid house beer! What more can you ask for besides a friendly bar tender. Oh ya they got that too!
author: James W.

description: I'm so glad Black Sands finally opened! Great beer and a wonderful space. The food is also really good. It's going to be a great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Andrea S.

description: Awesome spot in lower haight that is well decorated, reasonably affordable and delightfully delicious. The brewery/kitchen opens at 5pm and 6pm respectively, so be sure to have something in your tummy before drinking a for a full hour. I had the coffee milk stout and my wife had a cocktail that had the word sin in it. The stout was fairly complex and not too heavy (5.6% abv), I'd easily drink it again. For food I ordered the crispy rice salad (vegan) and my wife ordered the cheeseburger. Both were awesome and chef Eric made sure I enjoyed the rice salad before getting back to work in the open kitchen. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Anthony S.

description: The food by Eric is impeccable! The burger is the best in the city! The vegan taco salad: I didn't even miss the meat and it's mind blowing how good it is. The brussel sprouts; I don't know what type of sorcery he used but it was phenomenal and I want to replicate it myself! Everything that comes out of his kitchen is wholesome, delicious,  and out of this world AMAZING! I wish I could eat here every night!
author: Kate Z.

description:
This is my weekend breakfast go to spot. The Breakfast Torta goes great with a cold beer, especially if they have a black IPA or stout on so you can make the excuse that you're drinking something with a coffee flavor to it.  

For lunch and dinner, their burger is one of the best around, and they've added some more options for sides to round out your plate. The sauces the chef makes have been amazing on everything I've tried. Split a plate of the friend chicken for an appetizer, its the best I've had in the area. 

Black sands makes some great beers which are constantly rotating so you can always try out something new. I like their SMaSH series beers so I can try out different hop varieties. 

Check out the homebrew shop next door that's open on weekends. It's a great place to pick up some ingredients and chat with the knowledgeable guys that run it. They will give you a good recipe or set you up with everything you need if you are just starting out.
author: Ben M.

description: Our favorite neighborhood bar/restaurant. Food is excellent and better than just typical "bar food". The guys here did a great job on delivering quality food and drink. From great coffee to good food - this place is a lower haight gem. If you are expecting a bar scene, this is not the place however if you are looking for a cozy date place or good chill place with friends, this is perfect. Tables are first come, first serve so expect to wait for a table if you are a group of people as it's a small space.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Checked this cool new brewery out last night. Sadly, they were out of the Patagonia Pale Ale. I had the hoppy rye ale, brewed by black sands. Very delicious. I also got the fries for a snack. They were tasty but I wasn't a huge fan of the homemade green goddess dressing. Looking forward to coming back soon. Oh! And our server was super attentive.
author: Nicole S.

description: I have only gotten coffee. The cold brew was okay, the cappuccino was really good.  Service is nice but sort of standoffish.
author: Katie P.

description: Well priced beer and food.The house beers are quite good and the location is just amazing. A minor drawback is that the place was super warm and the beer should have been a bit colder. Will give it another chance at al later date.
author: Juan B.

description: Good neighborhood spot in lower haight. Great space to hang at any time of day. Their beer selection is not huge but most people will find something they like. I've gotten their breakfast sandwich which is delicious, try it out!
author: Kevin S.

description: Just opening, this place is going to be great.  Nice space, good food, excellent beer, friendly staff.
author: Georges S.

description: Stellar atmosphere, great staff, and the food is delicious and original, stands out even in this city. Will be sure to return!
author: David G.

description: I've turned Black Sands in to a regular occurrence for me because the food and drinks/beer are just low key incredible. I'd suggest it to anyone looking for a delicious yet casual evening. Awesome place and great people.
author: Anush V.

description: Good food with great value.  Great beer.  A fun find.
author: Debra S.

description: Super fresh wheat beer this morning! Also tried the stout - perfect chocolate and coffee flavors. Food was okay - tried the breakfast polenta and chile verde. Smaller portions and not super filing. Toast was great though. Beautiful interior and great service. Would go again for beer and to try the dinner service.
author: jennifer m.

description: The breakfast torta was so good we ordered another round. Good beer and a great atmosphere. Is come back if I had the time on our vacation.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Interesting beer and cocktail selection. I got a sour cherry beer that was super tasty! We sat at the bar and enjoyed watching the chefs whip up delicious looking noodle dishes in the open (and very clean) kitchen. Would go back to try food next time.
author: Tessa B.

description: This brewpub has a great selection of house and guest brews, I particularly loved the double ipa. The food is average, thought the lamb noodles were over hyped. Friendly and helpful waitstaff and a great location made this eating and drinking experience quite pleasant...
author: Mike S.

description:
Went to Black Sands a few weeks ago. I live across the street and love that there is even more opening up in the area! I had the cold brew and a chorizo breakfast sandwich. Both were great! I thought the sandwich was a bit expensive for what it was. I want to say it was $10+ when it should really be something like $6-7. 

I love the environment: open, clean, and spacious.

Would definitely come back here!
author: Viet N.

description: The burger and fries were the best I've had in a long time!!! Highly recommended and cool chill spot!!
author: Julia S.

description: San Francisco mediocrity. I went with a friend the another night and we sat at the bar. The wait staff was confused and couldn't be bothered to be helpful.  I had the burger, which was really an $11 big mac.  Actually, thats an insult to the big mac. there was no flavor, it came with nothing, the bun was just bland, the patty was crunchy (not how i like my burgers). I mean, I'm not a big fan of maven across the street, but their burger just kills this place. My friend had the taco salad and she did not like it one bit.  Even the beers were boring.  How can you have 12 beers on tap not one is drinkable.  It shocks me that this place can exist, but then i remember that SF loves mediocre boring food presented in a fashionable way.  Try at your own risk.
author: Noah M.

description: I just did an end zone dance with tears in my eyes, this place is so good.  And as an extra plus, the cool kids haven't quite figured out that this place exists, so we've never had to wait to be seated (though I expect that to change soon).  So Black Sands opened up on a pretty inconspicuous corner of Haight Street.  It doesn't have much signage (if any) on the outside, so it's easy to mistake as just another overpriced SF living unit.  But if you actually notice the glass door leading into a dining room, consider yourself in luck.  What lies inside is a food and drink experience that will make you ask "why have I not coming here my whole life?"  For starters, it only opened last year, so i can forgive myself for that.  What is somewhat less forgivable is that I haven't yet tried everything on my menu. But that's also difficult since they rotate their dishes quite frequently.  But, alas, the dishes I have tried have all been ridiculously delicious.   Ridiculously.  I have come at breakfast, for pre-dinner snacks and cocktails [yes, the concept of pre-dinner snacking is totally acceptable to me], and full on dinner.  Blown away every time.  My most recent meal involved a fried chicken sandwich, roasted fingerling potatoes, pumpkin seed hummus, and some bourbon.  In short, it was perfect.  I've actually had their fingerlings on a few occasions [they are part of the starters menu, which they begin serving at 4:00] and feel that every meal here should start with an order of these.  Also notable are their cocktails.  I'm no longer 21, so I really detest sweet bombs.  However, i find a lot of cocktails that are intended to be less spring-breakish to be, well, disappointingly odd tasting.  Not so at Black Sands.  Their cocktails are subtle and smooth and will make you feel like a Humphrey Bogart movie.  One note, this place doesn't have a big wine selection, so leave your fake ability to detect citrus notes at the door.  But trust me, you won't miss it at all.
author: Ash T.

description:
Great house brews
Fish tacos were delicious
Could be better use of space and stronger menu
author: Helen M.

description:
I really like this place.

It is just the sort of place that I've been looking for.  Clean, and pleasant, but not terribly expensive and with a lot of energy.  A great place for a casual beer and a bit of nosh.
author: Bill G.

description: This is a great neighborhood spot. These guys have been super helpful for those looking to start brewing beer as a hobby. Now, the restaurant is open and they offer amazing beer and great food. The great part is they have all of the recipes for the beer you just tried- they want you to try to recreate it! We've been a few times already and have taken friends in that all love it.
author: Michael T.

description: Black Sands knocked it out of the park at SF Beer Week opening Gala.  Superb Mosaic SMASH and Son of Man IPA.  This brewpub is run by a passionate team whose much needed contribution to the Lower Haight beer and food scene is truly appreciated!
author: steve c.

description: Great Beer, good service. Very average food and poor use of space. I am hopeful that the formula will improve since they just opened.
author: Neil L.
